notesStmt.note: Dirt, especially at edges. Glue stain. Originally folded. Some ink smears.
A Latin note on folio 190r: 'Judici cuiusda hebrei super causa Regis.'
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

supportDesc.extent: 2 folios (foliated and bound left to right): 190 and 191. Entire MS has 436 folios.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 16th century. Probably the autograph of Jacob Rafael of Modena.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Letters and Papers relative to the divorce of Henry VIII. Arundel 151.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Museum from the Royal Society of London together with 549 other Arundel manuscripts in 1831.
